description: Re-development of land at the rear of Nos 11 to 15 The Mall to provide a part single, part two, part three, part four and part five storey building with basement, comprising 14 self-contained flats (6 x 1 bed, 6 x 2 bed and 2 x 3 bed) arranged over the first to fourth floor (following part demolition of the existing extensions and structures to the rear of Nos. 11 to 15); Proposed A3 Use (Restaurant) at basement; Existing A3 Restaurant Use at ground floor of No. 13 The Mall to be extended into the rear of No. 12, change of use of ground floor of No. 12 The Mall from A1 Retail to C3 Residential (to form Entrance Lobby to Flats), to include alteration to front facade; alterations to existing air extract plant at Nos. 11, 12 and 13; one disabled parking space; bicycle, refuse and recycling stores.
decision_conditions: A sustainable drainage strategy, including ground water levels monitoring, shall be integrated into the proposal and fully operational prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained and mantained.   Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance with policy 2.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.12 & 5.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the acoustic enclosures of the kitchen air extracts proposed on the existing building.  Reason: In the interests to secure acceptable living conditions of occupiers of the existing self-contained units at 11-15 The Mall, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 1105/E101 A Rev A, 1105/E105 A Rev A, 1105/P01 Rev C, 1105/P02 A Rev A, 1105/P03 Rev B, 1105/P04, 1105/P05, 1105/P06, 1105/P07, 1105/P08 Rev A, 1105/P09 Rev A, 1105/P10 Rev A, 1105/P11, 1105/P12, Design and Access Statement dated June 2004, Preliminary Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment dated March 2014, Preliminary BREEAM Report dated March 2014, Noise Impact Statemenr dated April 2014, Financial Viability Apprasial dated June 2014 and Transport Statement dated March 2015. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces (including measures to prevent potential glare of the southern elevation glazing) of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level), and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details. Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes selected harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.1(g)(h), 1.2(f)(g), and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works a detailed Construction Method Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles, delivery times, dust mitigation and suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not affect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The details submitted should directly cross-reference with the BMP & mitigation measures as detailed in the following guidance: i) The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014 ii) BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of Practice for noise & vibration control on construction and open sites - Part 1: Noise   The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (f)(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies policies 1.1 (e)(f) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, one of the residential units hereby approved shall be laid out to disabled standards and permanently retained as such.   Reason: To secure a disabled standard unit and to comply with accessibility matters, in accordance with policies 3.8 and 7.2 of the London Plan and policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Core Strategy (2012). | Before first occupation of any part of the proposed development, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (in respect of access, internal floor space, water efficiency and energy). The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  "	After commencement of development. Within 3 months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes latest technical guidance and CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  "	After completion of Development  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.   Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the CfSH Level 4 shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.    Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policy 5.2G of Ealing Development Management DPD (10th December 2013), Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015. | The non-residential building hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on the latest BREEAM NC Technical Guidance).   i) Within 3 months of the commencement of the non-residential element of the development, evidence that the non-residential building is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the latest guidance of BREEAM New Construction Scheme and Interim Design Stage Assessment and Certificates verified by BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.    ii) The non-residential element of the development shall not be occupied until a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment verified by the BRE has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures will be achieved.    iii) Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the non-residential element of the development a Post-Construction Stage Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been achieved. Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the non-residential element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policy 5.2I of Ealing Development Management DPD (10th December 2013), Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015. | Prior to first occupation of each element of the development, details shall be submitted to demonstrate that the development as a whole shall incorporate and  maintain measures to achieve a reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 30.4% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013, the carbon emission savings shall be achieved as per Energy Strategy (Rev 1.0) prepared by AJ Energy Consultants Limited (25th November 2014):  "	energy saving measures implemented to the whole development to achieve an overall percentage reduction of at least of 3.3% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over complaint Part L 2013 base case  "	incorporation of solar PV and ASHP's technologies of 15.25kWp(97.6) and 16kW capacity, respectively, to achieve at least a percentage of 28% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the 'Be Lean' stage.  Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be part of details submitted.  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the development is energy efficient and contributes to reducing the need for fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2015, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Ealing's Development Management DPD, December 2013. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2015),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | Existing trees adjacent/close to the boundaries of the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be carried out only in accordance with British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.  Reason:  In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, in pursuance to the objectives of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.4, 7.8 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015,  policies 1.1 (e)(g)(h), 1.2(f) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7Cof the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the Local Planning Authority criteria shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and shall include the noise exposure category, the rating noise of the site and vibration levels.  The details shall also include the building envelope noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, screening for external amenity areas where necessary and attenuation of building services plant. The details shall include and demonstrate that: : "	The area of glazing will not greater than one twentieth of the floor area of living rooms, dining rooms and bedrooms.  "	Specifically designed triple glazing will be utilised, comprising an external sealed double glazed unit in thick glass with an independent internal single glazed unit.  "	A double cavity external wall will be installed, comprising a double skinned sound barrier masonry outer wall with a free standing inner studwork partition, nominal overall thickness 450mm.  "	Passive "whole house" ventilation ducted from the roof will be installed, with sound attenuators fitted to ducts, if necessary.  "	The building envelope around bedrooms facing the railway will achieve a calculated composite sound reduction of 55 dB Rw to meet the required internal level for bedrooms of not greater than 45 dB LAmax.  ii) The details to be submitted, shall demonstrate that the calculation of the minimum composite sound reductions for the elements making up the building envelopes are correct by the carrying out of field tests in a certified laboratory on representative samples of these elements together (walls/windows/doors), the tests to be carried out in accordance with the procedure at BS EN ISO 140-3: 1995 & BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010.  iii) The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests to secure an acceptable internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced to demonstrate that the whole house ventilation system has been tested and designed to meet the following requirements:  "	Noise within habitable rooms of dwellings from the operation of MEV or MVHR system not to exceed 28 dB LAeq,5min. "	Commissioning tests to be carried out before dwellings and other sensitive spaces are occupied to demonstrate that the above mentioned noise criteria is complied with and that the system is operating as designed for. "	Details of an ongoing maintenance programme to be submitted for approval, including the replacement of filters at approved intervals and cleaning of the ductwork. "	Details to be submitted to demonstrate compliance with BS EN 13141-7: 2010, Ventilation for buildings - Performance testing of components / products for residential ventilation - Part 7.  Reason: In the interests to secure an acceptable internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential units above to demonstrate that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  Reason: In the interests to secure an acceptable internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142:2014, shall not exceed the background sound levels, during the periods of operation at daytime, nightime and weekends.  Reason: Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Deliveries and collections of goods and waste at the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0700 - 2000 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the installation of the equipment, for its operation, and maintenance of the best practicable extract system for the commercial kitchens, including the provision of a suitable extract fan, approved odour control filtration equipment, a vertical discharge without any capping and a satisfactory discharge height.  The details shall satisfy the advice at "DEFRA, 2005: Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems".  The system, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015), policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and British Standard 4142. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall have been made to secure a car-free development in accordance with a detailed scheme or agreement which has been approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved scheme or agreement must ensure that:  a) all occupiers of the approved flats cannot apply for, obtain or hold an on-street parking permit to park a vehicle on the public highway within the administrative district of the local planning authority (other than a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 or similar legislation); b) all occupiers of the approved flats are required to surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held; and c) such a scheme or agreement shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall be retained and operated for so long as the use hereby permitted continues.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policy 6.13 and policy 6.13 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2015). | The commercial units hereby approved shall only be used for restaurant/cafe (A3 use class) and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.   Reason: To protect the vitality and viability of the Ealing Town Centre in accordance with policies 1.1 (a) (d), 1.2 (c), and 3.1 (b) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 2.15, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan 2015 and section 1 and 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | A detailed delivery/servicing operational management plan (to include refuse collections for the different uses comprising development) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first use of the development. The development shall be implemented and operated only in accordance with the approved details, and the approved arrangements shall be permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety  and an apporpriate operation of the development in accordance with policies  policies 1.1(e) (j) 1.2 (i)of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.16, 5.17, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the Consolidated London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the depth and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimize the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement. Reason: The proposed works will be in close proximity to underground sewerage utility infrastructure. Piling has the potential to impact on local underground sewerage utility infrastructure. The applicant is advised to contact Thames Water Developer Services on 0845 850 2777 to discuss the details of the piling method statement.  Reason: To prevent and minimize the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure in accordance with policy 5.14 of the London Plan 2015.
